page.title: 05Great Houghton Pigeon Club
page.content: {Great Houghton Pigeon Club}was formed in 1946.Today there are approximatly{20 members.}It meets in an old shed at the back of the{Old {Crown}across from the Post Office.The pigeons are usually collected on a Friday but are released, or liberated, as it is called, on the Saturday if the weather is suitable.Before the race each person enters the details of their particular pigeon;the breed, ring number,and whether the bird is a cock or a hen. The pigeon is given a cod liver oil tablet on the Thursday and another one just before the race. Usually the race begins in{France}and finishes when the bird reaches its home loft. The pigeons are trained from Ravensfield.They are collected by the{Pigeon Federation Transporter, which is a large lorry specially designed to carry pigeons.
